name: Todd Lake Campground
Reservations: Reservations are not currently available for this site.
Fees: NA
Restrictions: Do not remove frogs or tadpoles from Todd Lake.  Todd Lake is home for the Western Toad and Cascade Frog.  Both of these species are threatened by loss of wetlands, habitat degredation, and environmental changes.  They are protected by the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife and collecting of these species is illegal and punishable with a fine of $1250.00 (OAR 6330440130).
Information Center: NA
Passes: There is no fee for camping but this is a Recreation Fee Area.  Fee season is from May 1st - September 30th.  Click here for passes that are accepted.

name: Cinder Hill Campground
Reservations: Newberry Caldera will experience short term closures to allow for the safe removal of trees showing signs of future failure due of insect infestations or disease. Removing these trees helps maintain the beauty of the Caldera and health of our forest for years to come. As a result, reservations will be opened for this campground in 2018 only after the trees have been removed.   Sites are available on a first-come, first-served basis outside of the closures. Reservations can be made online at Recreation.gov or by calling toll free 1-877-444-6777 (International 518-885-3639 or TDD 877-833-6777). For additional information about the campground, please visit HoodooRecreation.com.
Fees:
Camping: Per night, per site fee: Regular site: $18/first vehicle; $9/each additional vehicle.  Dump station at nearby Paulina Lake Campground: $10.
	Day use: $5/vehicle/day or valid recreation pass at Cinder Hill Boating Site.
Restrictions: Maximum site spur length is 30 feet.
Information Center: Located within the Newberry National Volcanic Monument area on the Deschutes National Forest; operated by Hoodoo Recreation Service.
Passes:
Camping: 50% discount for single site camping with any of these passes: Interagency Senior, Interagency Access, Golden Age, or Golden Access.
	Day use: Recreation Passes may be used as a form of fee payment.

name: Little Crater Campground
Reservations:
Newberry Caldera will experience short term closures to allow for the safe removal of trees showing signs of future failure due of insect infestations or disease. As a result, reservations will be opened for this campground in 2018 only through September 2, 2018. Day use and boat launch will close the same day for the season. 
Caldera boat ramps not affected are Hot Springs Boat Launch, East Lake Resort and Paulina Lake Lodge. Reservations can be made online at Recreation.gov or by calling toll free 1-877-444-6777 (International 518-885-3639 or TDD 877-833-6777). For additional information about the campground, please visit HoodooRecreation.com.
Fees: Per night, per site fee: $18/first vehicle; $9/each additional vehicle.Dump Station near the entrance to Paulina Campground: $10.
Restrictions: Maximum site spur length is 30 feet.
Information Center: Located within the Newberry National Volcanic Monument on the Deschutes National Forest; operated by Hoodoo Recreation Service.
Passes: A valid Recreation Pass is required at Little Crater Boating and Picnic Site from May 1 through September 30.
